example: The Cretaceous-Paleogene mass extinction wiped out the dinosaurs about 66 million years ago.
Before the mass extinction, dinosaurs were the dominant species on Earth.
Volcanic ash can block out sunlight, causing global temperatures to drop.
The asteroid strike was devastating many species across the planet.
Climate change can have a profound effect on ecosystems and biodiversity.
The collapse of a species can disrupt the entire food chain in an ecosystem.
The Permian-Triassic extinction was marked by massive volcanic activity.
Landslides can displace large amounts of soil, destroying habitats in the process.
An asteroid strike is one of the theories explaining the dinosaur extinction.
Volcanoes release sulfur dioxide, which can affect the release sulfur dioxide, which can affect the atmosphere and climate.
Ocean acidification has serious consequences for marine life and coral reefs.
Pollinators play a crucial role in the reproduction of many plant species.
Conservation efforts can help recover many species from the brink of extinction.
Certain pollutants can damage the nervous system of animals and humans.
Laws prohibit industries from dumping toxic waste into rivers.
If habitats continue to be destroyed, more species will become extinct.
The decline of sea levels can expose coastal habitats, affecting marine species.
Deforestation leads to the destruction of habitats for many wildlife species.
Coastal and shallow-ocean species are vulnerable to changes in sea temperature and acidity.
The extinction of a top predator can have a profound effect on food chains.
Asteroid impacts can cause massive climate cooling by blocking sunlight.
Volcanic activity during the Triassic period may have contributed to a mass extinction.

english: release large amounts of sulfur dioxide
example: Supervolcanoes can release large amounts of sulfur dioxide into the atmosphere.
Aerosols in the atmosphere can lower global temperatures by reflecting sunlight.
An asteroid impact can create massive amounts of crushed rock and dust.
Dust from a volcanic eruption can block sunlight for months or years.
Disruption of the food chain can cause many species to starve.
Species that can adapt to changes in their environment are more likely to survive.
Many species can adapt to gradual environmental changes over time.

english: excess SO2 cleared from the atmosphere
chinese: 多余的二氧化硫被清除
example: Over time, excess SO2 is cleared from the atmosphere by natural processes.

english: date to millions of years ago
example: Fossils of extinct species often date to millions of years ago.
Some animals have natural defenses to prevent infection by pathogens.
Thickening of the skin can help some animals survive in harsh environments.
Animals in drought-stricken areas may die of dehydration.
Conservationists apply antifungal treatments to save endangered amphibians.
Scientists experiment with ways to kill the fungus with heat in controlled environments.
Sensitive frog populations are threatened by habitat loss and disease.
Natural habitats are threatened by urbanization and industrial development.
Many bird species are dependent on wetland habitats for feeding and nesting.
Excessive water use can dry up wetlands, threatening dependent species.
Scientists research solutions to declining populations of endangered species.

english: prohibit the use of harmful pesticides
example: Some countries prohibit the use of harmful pesticides to protect wildlife.

english: play a role in protecting ecosystems
chinese: 在保护生态系统中发挥作用
example: Conservation organizations play a role in protecting ecosystems worldwide.
Disease-carrying insects can threaten both human and animal health.
Experts propose methods to solve problems of habitat destruction and climate change.

english: mass extinction at the end of the Triassic period
example: The mass extinction at the end of the Triassic period paved the way for dinosaur dominance.
New fossil discoveries challenge the theories about ancient mass extinctions.
Species that can adapt to gradual changes have a better chance of survival.
Conservation strategies need to apply on a large scale to be effective.
Climate change can affect food chains worldwide, from the poles to the equator.
